result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:45 PM  Defendant Dah Leh Loo in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Dah Leh Loo.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cynas Hla is sworn in as interpreter for this matter who appears by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into case 21CF1720.
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into 21CF1720.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:29 AM Defendant Dah Leh Loo in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Dah Leh Loo.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cynas Hla appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in.  

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Defendant to be returned to Dodge Correctional Institution forthwith. 
Attorney Hughes requests a date for plea and sentencing and for the defendant to be produced.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional Institution.  
Interpreter states he is available for the next date and this information to be relayed to the interpreter scheduler so Mr. Hla may potentially be scheduled as interpreter.  
KAREN INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR NEXT DATE.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional Institution
Detainer placed at: Dodge Correctional Institution
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

2:05 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant Dah Leh Loo appeared by video, in custody, at Dodge Correctional In.  Attorney Steven Hughes appeared by video for Dah Leh Loo. Len Bathin appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in.All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Hughes is appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCED FROM DODGE CORRECTIONAL FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
KAREN INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on August 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
